body_html:
Hi all,

About ImportError: libcudnn.so.6: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory. In order to solve this problem, you have to download from cuda https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda-downloads the appropriate package for your system and write in your ~/.bashrc :
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH="$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:/usr/local/cuda/lib64:/path/to/your/new/cuda/lib64".
usr/local/cuda/lib64 is the native path for cuda files and you want add the new files you downloaded.
That's why you write : followed by the new path.
"$LD_LIBRARY_PATH is the expression used in linux for library paths.
Be careful about having the lastest version for tensorflow (1.3.0).
Hope it helps.

body:
Hi all,

About `ImportError: libcudnn.so.6: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory`. In order to solve this problem, you have to download from cuda [https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda-downloads](url) the appropriate package for your system and write in your `~/.bashrc` : 
`export LD_LIBRARY_PATH="$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:/usr/local/cuda/lib64:/path/to/your/new/cuda/lib64"`. 
`usr/local/cuda/lib64` is the native path for cuda files and you want add the new files you downloaded. 
That's why you write `:` followed by the new path.
`"$LD_LIBRARY_PATH` is the expression used in linux for library paths.
Be careful about having the lastest version for tensorflow (1.3.0).
Hope it helps.
